intro: Narduretia delicatula f. viciosoi, commonly known as the delicate narduretia, is a rare and delicate plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant is native to specific regions in southern Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
